noun.description: The action of reducing the severity, seriousness, or painfulness of something.
examples: the emphasis is on the identification and mitigation of pollution

phrases: in mitigation she said her client had been deeply depressed
It raises matters as to his conviction and in mitigation of sentence.
Your adviser can make a statement about your background or in mitigation of punishment.
In mitigation I must remind you: this was the beginning of the Seventies.
What is the remedy where a fraudulent plea in mitigation of sentence produces an inadequate sentence?
origin: Late Middle English: from Old French, or from Latin mitigatio(n-), from the verb mitigare alleviate (see mitigate).
